clinical_study.brief_title: Comparing Two Different Rehabilitation Protochols on Patients With Rotator Cuff Repair
clinical_study.official_title: Comparing Two Different Rehabilitation Protochols on Patients With Rotator Cuff Repair

brief_summary.textblock: Rotator cuff (RC) repair is one of the most common treatment approch to relief the pain and improve the shoulder function on patients with rotator cuff rupture. Despite the improved surgical techniques and decreased failure rate, there are still complications after the surgey like shoulder persistant shoulder pain, stiffness even re-tear. Therefore, rehabilitation after the RC repair procedure is crucial for the success of the treatment. However, there is no concencus between the post-operative rehabilitation protochol. The aim of this study is to compare two different rehabilitation protochols on patients with RC repair.

detailed_description.textblock: Rotator cuff (RC) repair is one of the most common treatment approch to relief the pain and improve the shoulder function on patients with rotator cuff rupture. Despite the improved surgical techniques and decreased failure rate, there are still complications after the surgey like shoulder persistant shoulder pain, stiffness even re-tear. Therefore, rehabilitation after the RC repair procedure is crucial for the success of the treatment. However, there is no concencus between the post-operative rehabilitation protochol. The aim of this study is to compare two different rehabilitation protochols in terms of shoulder range of motion, self-reported shoulder function and pain on patients with RC repair.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Having a Rotator Cuff repair surgery
- Having post-op rehabilitation program at our clinic until post-op 3 months
- No previous surgery in the shoulder joint
Exclusion Criteria:
- Additional pathology other then RC tear
- Refusing to participate to the study
